content: Prevention and management of nausea and vomiting associated with pain management medications.
4 mg q 8 hrs, repeat after 15 min for persistent symptoms, no more than 8 mg/8 hr time block
Hypersensitivity to ondansetron, use cautiously in patients with hepatic failure, considered relatively safe in pregnancy, if clinically indicated
Dizziness, lightheadedness, headache, sedation, diarrhea, constipation, dry mouth

TACTICAL CONSIDERATIONS: Do not use PO (pill form) â€“ use translingual with the oral dissolving tablet (oral ondansetron is NOT an acceptable alternative to the ODT formulation); do not handle ODT preparation with wet hands; IV and IO should be given by slow push.
